name: Radioiodine-Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma
chief_complaint: Persistent neck swelling and fatigue despite previous radioactive iodine treatment
treatment: External beam radiation for symptomatic metastases
prognosis: Guarded with median survival of 3-5 years after diagnosis of refractoriness
description: A challenging subset of differentiated thyroid cancer that loses the ability to concentrate radioactive iodine despite TSH stimulation, often with aggressive metastatic behavior. Typically develops after multiple I-131 treatments with progressive thyroglobulin elevation and imaging evidence of disease progression.
